intro: Topobea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered topobea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
